full_summary:
**Title**
Impact Assessment of Climate Change Provisions for Structural Design of Buildings

**Reference Number**
PW-22-01000854

**Publication Date**
August 11, 2022

**Tender Closing Date**
August 25, 2022, 2:00 PM EDT

**Bid Status**
Closed

**Contracting Entity**
National Research Council Canada
100 Sussex Dr, Ottawa, ON, Canada K1A 0R6
Phone: 514-496-6108
Email: [stephane.lajoie@nrc-cnrc.gc.ca](mailto:stephane.lajoie@nrc-cnrc.gc.ca)

**Description**
The National Research Council Canada is seeking a service provider to assess the impact of climate change on the structural design of buildings in Canada. The successful bidder will evaluate the change in design requirements and costs of primary and secondary structural systems using the current National Building Code provisions for wind and snow, and proposed provisions that consider the impacts of climate change on wind and snow loads. This assessment will be carried out for typical buildings at various locations across Canada.

The bidder will provide a comprehensive report detailing the assessment of the impact of climate change on the structural design of buildings in Canada, including:

* An evaluation of the current National Building Code provisions for wind and snow loads;
* An assessment of the proposed provisions that consider the impacts of climate change on wind and snow loads;
* A comparison of the design requirements and costs of primary and secondary structural systems using the current and proposed provisions; and
* A recommendation for the implementation of the proposed provisions.

**Method of Procurement**
This tender is subject to a competitive and limited tendering process. Bids must be submitted electronically through the Government of Canada website.

**Attachment**
The tender document, including the bid form and instructions, is available on the Government of Canada website.
